translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Bhaddāli
The Elder Ucchaṅgapupphīya’s Birth Story
“At that time, in the city of Bandhumatī,
I was a garland maker.
Having filled my shoulder-basket,
I went to the market.🔽At that time,

analyzed: bhagavā tamhi samaye  bhikkhu saṅgha purakkhato
translated: the Blessed One,
with great majesty,

analyzed: niyyāti loka nāyako  disvāna loka pajjota
translated: was leaving, the world’s leader.🔽Having seen the world’s light,
I saw the world’s protector.
Having placed a flower on my shoulder-basket,
I worshipped the best of Buddhas.
For ninety-one eons,🔽the flower I worshipped
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live undefiled.
Welcome indeed it was for me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.
The four analytical insights,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done.”

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā ucchaṅgapupphiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai ucchaṅgapupphiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: Thus the elder Ucchaṅgapupphīya recited these verses.
The Elder Ucchaṅgapupphīya’s Birth Story, the seventh.
